p: Climate change is a global phenomenon that results in global warming, droughts, flooding and depletion of natural resources (Adger et al. 2003; Parry et al. 2004; Naqvi and Sejian 2011). A study by Nelson et al. ( 2009) indicated that climate change is expected to bring about significant yield losses between 3 and 30 % and extinction of land plants and animal species between 15 and 37 % by 2050 unless remedial measures are taken into consideration. Developing countries are highly vulnerable to climate change since their economy predominantly relies on rain-fed agriculture that totally depends on natural factors. Traditional farming systems practiced, which have low technological capacity, cannot help to adapt and mitigate drastic climate change (Tubiello 2012).
